itemDescription: British dressage rider competing at Olympic level

wikipedia_page.main:
Laura Tomlinson MBE (née Bechtolsheimer; born 31 January 1985, in Mainz, Germany) is a German-born British dressage rider competing at Olympic level.
As of 30 June 2012 the Fédération Équestre Internationale (FEI) ranked her 3rd in the world riding Mistral Højris and 36th on Andretti H. In that year, Tomlinson, riding Mistral Højris under her maiden name of Laura Bechtolsheimer, won two medals in the 2012 Summer Olympics in London; gold for Great Britain in the team dressage with Carl Hester and Charlotte Dujardin, the first ever Olympic team gold in the discipline for her country, and bronze in the individual dressage behind gold medalist and compatriot Dujardin.

Equestrian at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Team dressage

response: Klaus Balkenhol (born 6 December 1939 in Velen) is a German equestrian and Olympic champion. He won a gold medal in team dressage at the 1992 Summer Olympics in Barcelona with the team from Germany. Balkenhol is the author of several dressage books. He is an avid member of Xenophen, and like Philippe Karl petitions against the use of rollkur. Balkenhol's earlier riding career consisted of being a mounted policeman. He was also the coach of the U.S. Olympic team."1992 Summer Olympics – Barcelona, Spain – Equestrian"  databaseOlympics.com (Retrieved on 21 September 2008) He also received a gold medal with the German team in 1996."1996 Summer Olympics – Atlanta, United States – Equestrian"  databaseOlympics.com (Retrieved on 21 September 2008) At present Balkenhol is the trainer of Olympic equestrian Laura Bechtolsheimer.

on 27 August 2012 he was engaged to German-born British dressage rider Laura Bechtolsheimer. The couple married in the Swiss resort of Arosa on 2 March 2013. They have three children (Annalisa, Wilfred and Hanni) and are expecting a fourth in 2021.
